reg:regulation.reg:title:
Retention of Provincial Parks
Parking Fees Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 248/2007, July 6, 2007]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: operator means an operator as defined in the Park, Conservancy and Recreation Area Regulation;
parking pass fees means the fees payable for a parking pass.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An operator who has contracted with the government to collect day parking fees is authorized to retain a negotiated amount of up to 70% of those fees as remuneration for services performed.

An operator who has contracted with the government to collect parking pass fees is authorized to retain, as remuneration for services performed, $7.00 of the parking pass fees for each parking pass sold by the operator.

If so authorized by a contract between Tourism British Columbia and the government, Tourism British Columbia is authorized to retain, as remuneration for services performed, $9.00 of the parking pass fees for each parking pass sold by Tourism British Columbia or by subcontractors of Tourism British Columbia.

A person, other than an operator or Tourism British Columbia, who has contracted with the government to collect parking pass fees on the government's behalf is authorized to retain a negotiated amount of up to 35% of the parking pass fees collected as remuneration for services performed.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Financial Administration Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 138, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 14 (2)]
